title: It’s an age of leaderless movements but can they succeed in India?
selftext: The larger question may be whether it is possible to galvanize all of India on any issue that unites all its fragments, and that too without leadership. At a national level, the answer must be ‘no.’ Indian society’s tapestry of religions, languages, castes, tribes and classes has distinctly varied interests, which have grown further apart in recent decades.
comments: Hi redtopian, your submission has been removed as /r/India limits users to 6 submissions in 24 hours.
